description: stylized thin trees against a dark pink sky; lower half background is light green with black or dark brown tree trunks; framed in a simple black wood frame with glass allowing verso to be visible; verso is printing from a "Breeze" laundry detergent box with photo of a woman holding a sheet
markings: tape on back of glass, graphite: 008
text: Frank Walter was a self-taught artist with a keen intellect and thirst for knowledge, who created a body of work that encompasses a variety of mediums, subject matter, and styles. Walter painted from his heart, composing subjects drawn from his imagination and everyday life, such as this landscape scene with a stand of trees set against a brilliant reddish-pink "hurricane" sky. His paintings function as visions that evoke emotion and mystery, mirroring life itself.
title: Forest with Hurricane Sky
